item.title: Susan add a quote by JK Rowling
item.description: "Things we lose have a way of coming back to us in the end, if not always in the way we expect." -- JK Rowling

item.title: Susan add a quote by Fran Lebowitz
item.description: "Think before you speak. Read before you think." -- Fran Lebowitz

item.title: Susan add a quote by Bertolt Brecht
item.description: "Hungry man, reach for the book: it is a weapon." -- Bertolt Brecht

item.title: Susan add a quote by Andy Warhol
item.description: "Don't pay any attention to what they write about you. Just measure it in inches." -- Andy Warhol

item.title: Susan add a quote by Samuel Lover
item.description: "Circumstances are the rulers of the weak; they are but the instruments of the wise." -- Samuel Lover

item.title: Susan add a quote by William Shakespeare
Susan add a quote by Galileo Galilei
item.description: "I have never met a man so ignorant that I couldn't learn something from him." -- Galileo Galilei

item.title: Susan add a quote by Jules Renard
item.description: "The truly free man is the one who can turn down an invitation to dinner without giving an excuse." -- Jules Renard

item.title: Susan add a quote by André Breton
item.description: "My wish is that you may be loved to the point of madness." -- André Breton

item.title: Susan add a quote by George Sand
item.description: "Guard well within yourself that treasure, kindness. Know how to give without hesitation, how to lose without regret, how to acquire without meanness." -- George Sand

item.title: Susan add a quote by Amy Tan
item.description: "We dream to give ourselves hope. To stop dreaming - well, that’s like saying you can never change your fate." -- Amy Tan

item.title: Susan add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "Reality is that which, when you stop believing in it, doesn't go away." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Susan add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "Music expresses that which cannot be said and on which it is impossible to be silent." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Susan add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "Make up a story... For our sake and yours forget your name in the street; tell us what the world has been to you in the dark places and in the light. Don't tell us what to believe, what to fear. Show us belief's wide skirt and the stitch that unravels fear's caul." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Susan add a quote by Chaim Potok
item.description: "I've begun to realize that you can listen to silence and learn from it. It has a quality and a dimension all its own." -- Chaim Potok

item.title: Susan add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Susan add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Susan add a quote by E.M. Forster
item.description: "It isn't possible to love and part. You will wish that it was. You can transmute love, ignore it, muddle it, but you can never pull it out of you. I know by experience that the poets are right: love is eternal." -- E.M. Forster

item.title: Susan add a quote by Ovid
item.description: "Chance is always powerful. Let your hook be always cast; in the pool where you least expect it, there will be a fish." -- Ovid

item.title: Susan add a quote by Lawrence Ferlinghetti
item.description: "Poetry is eternal graffiti written in the heart of everyone." -- Lawrence Ferlinghetti

item.title: Susan add a quote by Edward Albee
item.description: "What I mean by an educated taste is someone who has the same tastes that I have." -- Edward Albee

item.title: Susan add a quote by Stéphane Mallarmé
item.description: "Everything in the world exists in order to end up as a book." -- Stéphane Mallarmé

item.title: Susan add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Susan add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Susan add a quote by Maxim Gorky
item.description: "Happiness always looks small while you hold it in your hands, but let it go, and you learn at once how big and precious it is." -- Maxim Gorky

item.title: Susan add a quote by Lawrence Durrell
item.description: "Does not everything depend on our interpretation of the silence around us?" -- Lawrence Durrell

item.title: Susan add a quote by Sean O'Casey
item.description: "When it was dark, you always carried the sun in your hand for me." -- Sean O'Casey

item.title: Susan add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "April 1. This is the day upon which we are reminded of what we are on the other three hundred and sixty-four." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Susan add a quote by Elbert Hubbard
item.description: "Every man is a damn fool for at least five minutes every day; wisdom consists in not exceeding the limit." -- Elbert Hubbard

item.title: Susan add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "You may not control all the events that happen to you, but you can decide not to be reduced by them." -- Maya Angelou
